title: Digital Transformation of Islamic Religious Education: Flipped Learning and LMS Integration Strategies Considering Socio-Cultural Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Islamic education theory and understanding of traditional pedagogy, awareness of sociocultural diversity, basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Implementation strategies for digital transformation in smartphone-centric environments. Balancing digital competency enhancement for pre-/in-service teachers with preservation of Islamic values; consideration of religious education applicability in multicultural societies.

learning_goals: Learners develop three or more educational contents integrating Islamic culture, history, and ethics using flipped learning design principles on an LMS.
Learners produce two or more digital resources fostering civic literacy in Islamic societies using tools like quiz makers and video editors.

Learners can design one educational assessment rubric reflecting ethical considerations in the AI era (e.g., data bias, algorithmic transparency, privacy protection) and provide structured feedback (one strength, one improvement, specific examples) on at least two peers' rubrics, with mandatory consideration of harmonizing Islamic law (Sharia) principles and modern societal rights.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
